chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type
f: A -> nat

Goal:
forall (t1 t2 : btree A) (l : list (btree A)), weight_tree_list (node t1 t2 :: l) = sum_leaves t1 + sum_leaves t2 + weight_tree_list (t1 :: t2 :: l)

Premises:
sum_leaves = fix sum_leaves (t : btree A) : nat := match t with | leaf n => f n | node t1 t2 => sum_leaves t1 + sum_leaves t2 end : btree A -> nat
node : forall A : Type, btree A -> btree A -> btree A
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
weight_tree_list = fold_right (fun x : btree A => Init.Nat.add (weight_tree x)) 0 : list (btree A) -> nat Arguments weight_tree_list _%list_scope
Inductive btree (A : Type) : Type := leaf : A -> btree A | node : btree A -> btree A -> btree A Arguments btree _%type_scope Arguments leaf [A]%type_scope Arguments node [A]%type_scope
inb_antisym : forall (A : Type) (t1 t2 : btree A), inb t1 t2 -> inb t2 t1 -> t1 = t2
number_of_nodes_inb_le : forall (A : Type) (t1 t2 : btree A), inb t1 t2 -> number_of_nodes t1 <= number_of_nodes t2
distinct_leaves_r : forall (A : Type) (t1 t2 : btree A), distinct_leaves (node t1 t2) -> distinct_leaves t2
inb_trans : forall (A : Type) (t1 t2 t3 : btree A), inb t1 t2 -> inb t2 t3 -> inb t1 t3
weight_tree = fix weight_tree (t : btree A) : nat := match t with | leaf _ => 0 | node t1 t2 => sum_leaves t1 + weight_tree t1 + (sum_leaves t2 + weight_tree t2) end : btree A -> nat
distinct_leaves_l : forall (A : Type) (t1 t2 : btree A), distinct_leaves (node t1 t2) -> distinct_leaves t1
innodeR : forall (A : Type) (t t1 t2 : btree A), inb t t2 -> inb t (node t1 t2)
inb_sind : forall (A : Type) (P : btree A -> btree A -> SProp), (forall t : btree A, P t t) -> (forall t t1 t2 : btree A, inb t t1 -> P t t1 -> P t (node t1 t2)) -> (forall t t1 t2 : btree A, inb t t2 -> P t t2 -> P t (node t1 t2)) -> forall b b0 : btree A, inb b b0 -> P b b0
inb_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : btree A -> btree A -> Prop), (forall t : btree A, P t t) -> (forall t t1 t2 : btree A, inb t t1 -> P t t1 -> P t (node t1 t2)) -> (forall t t1 t2 : btree A, inb t t2 -> P t t2 -> P t (node t1 t2)) -> forall b b0 : btree A, inb b b0 -> P b b0
Inductive inb (A : Type) : btree A -> btree A -> Prop := inleaf : forall t : btree A, inb t t | innodeL : forall t t1 t2 : btree A, inb t t1 -> inb t (node t1 t2) | innodeR : forall t t1 t2 : btree A, inb t t2 -> inb t (node t1 t2) Arguments inb [A]%type_scope Arguments inleaf _%type_scope Arguments innodeL _%type_scope Arguments innodeR _%type_scope
innodeL : forall (A : Type) (t t1 t2 : btree A), inb t t1 -> inb t (node t1 t2)
permutation_swap : forall (A : Type) (a b : A) (l : list A), permutation (a :: b :: l) (b :: a :: l)
ordered_cons : forall (A : Type) (order : A -> A -> Prop) (a b : A) (l : list A), order a b -> ordered order (b :: l) -> ordered order (a :: b :: l)
ordered_inv_order : forall (A : Type) (order : A -> A -> Prop) (a b : A) (l : list A), ordered order (a :: b :: l) -> order a b
ordered_skip : forall (A : Type) (order : A -> A -> Prop), (forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c) -> forall (a b : A) (l : list A), ordered order (a :: b :: l) -> ordered order (a :: l)
ordered_sind : forall (A : Type) (order : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> SProp), P [] -> (forall a : A, P [a]) -> (forall (a b : A) (l : list A), order a b -> ordered order (b :: l) -> P (b :: l) -> P (a :: b :: l)) -> forall l : list A, ordered order l -> P l
ordered_ind : forall (A : Type) (order : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> Prop), P [] -> (forall a : A, P [a]) -> (forall (a b : A) (l : list A), order a b -> ordered order (b :: l) -> P (b :: l) -> P (a :: b :: l)) -> forall l : list A, ordered order l -> P l
ordered_inv : forall (A : Type) (order : A -> A -> Prop) (a : A) (l : list A), ordered order (a :: l) -> ordered order l
sum_order = fun x y : btree A => sum_leaves x <= sum_leaves y : btree A -> btree A -> Prop
ulist_cons : forall (A : Type) (a : A) (l : list A), ~ In a l -> ulist l -> ulist (a :: l)
Inductive permutation (A : Type) : list A -> list A -> Prop := permutation_nil : permutation [] [] | permutation_skip : forall (a : A) (l1 l2 : list A), permutation l2 l1 -> permutation (a :: l2) (a :: l1) | permutation_swap : forall (a b : A) (l : list A), permutation (a :: b :: l) (b :: a :: l) | permutation_trans : forall l1 l2 l3 : list A, permutation l1 l2 -> permutation l2 l3 -> permutation l1 l3 Arguments permutation [A]%type_scope (_ _)%list_scope Arguments permutation_nil _%type_scope Arguments permutation_skip _%type_scope _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments permutation_swap _%type_scope _ _ _%list_scope Arguments permutation_trans _%type_scope (_ _ _)%list_scope
permutation_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), P [] [] -> (forall (a : A) (l1 l2 : list A), permutation l2 l1 -> P l2 l1 -> P (a :: l2) (a :: l1)) -> (forall (a b : A) (l : list A), P (a :: b :: l) (b :: a :: l)) -> (forall l1 l2 l3 : list A, permutation l1 l2 -> P l1 l2 -> permutation l2 l3 -> P l2 l3 -> P l1 l3) -> forall l l0 : list A, permutation l l0 -> P l l0
permutation_sind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> SProp), P [] [] -> (forall (a : A) (l1 l2 : list A), permutation l2 l1 -> P l2 l1 -> P (a :: l2) (a :: l1)) -> (forall (a b : A) (l : list A), P (a :: b :: l) (b :: a :: l)) -> (forall l1 l2 l3 : list A, permutation l1 l2 -> P l1 l2 -> permutation l2 l3 -> P l2 l3 -> P l1 l3) -> forall l l0 : list A, permutation l l0 -> P l l0
unique_key_cons : forall (A B : Type) (a : A) (b : B) (l : list (A * B)), (forall b0 : B, ~ In (a, b0) l) -> unique_key l -> unique_key ((a, b) :: l)
Inductive ordered (A : Type) (order : A -> A -> Prop) : list A -> Prop := ordered_nil : ordered order [] | ordered_one : forall a : A, ordered order [a] | ordered_cons : forall (a b : A) (l : list A), order a b -> ordered order (b :: l) -> ordered order (a :: b :: l) Arguments ordered [A]%type_scope _%function_scope _%list_scope Arguments ordered_nil _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments ordered_one _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments ordered_cons _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _ _%list_scope
